name: Avoid unreferenced Display Files  (DDS400)
description: The rules searches for the unreferenced  Display Files
output:
This report lists DDS400 unreferenced Display File.
It provides the following information:
DDS400 Display File full name
rationale: The higher the number of unreferenced Display Files is, the more difficult the maintenance and evolution as all updates in referenced Display Files  will be.  In order the keep the same quality and performance of the application the the tests invesments must be increased.
remediation: Check if these files are really necessary. If not, then remove them.
remediationSample:
Sample Display File:

MCGANN/FILEX

RCDFMT ONE
Field 1
RCDFMT TWO
Field 2

CL Program which refers below,
PGM 
DCLF MCGANN/FILEX
sample: Display files should be referred in the Programs.Unreferred display files will make the search for the display files more time consuming
total: Total number of DDS400 Display File

technicalCriteria.name: ASCMM-MNT-20 - Unreachable Named Callable or Method Control Element

qualityStandards.name: Unreachable Named Callable or Method Control Element
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid inactive code blocks that can mistakenly be considered as active and that can hide the active code in noise

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of reuse requires more maintenance effort in order to propagate changes to all instances of duplicated code

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element is unreferenced by any other code item in the application (the application determines the scope of the search for code items that could call a callable or method control element)

qualityStandards.name: Dead Code
qualityStandards.description: The software contains dead code, which can never be executed.
